description: Use of bullet points (-, *, â€¢) for enumeration. This is the #2 most important feature (31.56 importance) and has highest SHAP importance (0.004474).

recommendations.critical: Use bullet points extensively throughout the motion, especially in key argument sections.
recommendations.rationale: Bullet points are the #2 most important structural feature (31.56 importance) and have 88.6% grant rate vs 84.9% without.
recommendations.key_insight: Bullet points signal organization, systematic thinking, and make arguments scannable for judges.

comparison_with_numbers.recommendation: Use bullets (preferred) or both bullets and numbers. Bullets have higher CatBoost importance (31.56 vs 0.00).

suggestions: Add bullet points in Good Cause sections (list factors)
Add bullet points in Privacy Harm arguments (enumerate harms)
Add bullet points in Danger/Safety arguments (list threats)
Add bullet points in Proposed Protective Measures (list measures)
Aim for 11+ bullet points per motion
